p: In this study, we employed the state-of-the-art proteomic technique SWATH-MS to identify and quantify the changes in proteins from hemocytes and plasma of B. siamensis goniomphalos following O. viverrini infection. We revealed several proteins potentially involved in the immune response of the snails that could play a critical role in the snail-trematode relationship, although future functional studies are needed to clarify the role of these proteins and better understand the immune response of Bithynia snails to O. viverrini.
